de.dfki.lt.hfc.operators

Class PrintSize

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Operator
      • de.dfki.lt.hfc.RelationalOperator
        • de.dfki.lt.hfc.operators.PrintSize

  • public final class PrintSize
extends RelationalOperator
    prints the size of the arguments (binding tables) given to apply() to standard out
    Since:
    JDK 1.5
    See Also:
    RelationalOperator

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class de.dfki.lt.hfc.Operator

        tupleStore

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PrintSize() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BindingTable[] apply(BindingTable[] args)
      !!! this is the one and only method that you MUST implement !!! IMPORTANT: READ NOTE: an implementation of this method might destructively work on the input binding tables, although brand-new ones might be created too; in both cases, some of these (not necessarily all) tables are given back, even one or even zero tables; all these result tables are then joined with the LHS binding table to which this complex predicate has been applied; a return value equals an *empty array* of binding tables (i.e., length = 0) is interepreted as a test that leaves the LHS binding table unaffected !! *empty binding tables* in the result array overall lead to an empty LHS binding table, resulting in no RHS instantiations

      • Methods inherited from class de.dfki.lt.hfc.RelationalOperator

        callFunctionalOperator, callRelationalOperator, obtainPositions

      • Methods inherited from class de.dfki.lt.hfc.Operator

        ask, ask, ask, getExternalRepresentation, getId, getObject, getProxy, getRelation, registerObject, setProxy, setRelation

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public BindingTable[] apply(BindingTable[] args)
        Description copied from class: RelationalOperator
        !!! this is the one and only method that you MUST implement !!! IMPORTANT: READ NOTE: an implementation of this method might destructively work on the input binding tables, although brand-new ones might be created too; in both cases, some of these (not necessarily all) tables are given back, even one or even zero tables; all these result tables are then joined with the LHS binding table to which this complex predicate has been applied; a return value equals an *empty array* of binding tables (i.e., length = 0) is interepreted as a test that leaves the LHS binding table unaffected !! *empty binding tables* in the result array overall lead to an empty LHS binding table, resulting in no RHS instantiations
        Specified by:
        apply in class RelationalOperator
